## Section 3. Waiver of 25% Co-payment for Hospital & Surgical Expenses
(Applicable to Enhanced, Premier or Exclusive Plan)
In the event, You are successful in Your claim under Section 2, Hospital and Surgical Expenses, the amount that You need to co-pay on the claimable amount as indicated under this section of the Policy shall be waived.

## Section 4. Wages & Levy Reimbursement
In the event Your Maid is hospitalized due to an Injury or Illness and You suffer the loss of service of the Maid during the Period of Insurance, We will pay You the pro-rata wages and government levy on foreign domestic workers up to the Benefit Limit per day as specified in the Policy Schedule for a period of maximum thirty (30) days, provided You are also successful in Your claim under Section 2, Hospital and Surgical Expenses.
questions: How does the waiver of the 25% co-payment under Section 3 apply when a claim is successful under Section 2 for hospital and surgical expenses, and what are the implications for the insured's out-of-pocket costs?
Under what conditions must a claim be successful under Section 2 for the waiver of the 25% co-payment in Section 3 to be applicable, and how does this affect the overall claim settlement?

What are the eligibility criteria and benefit limits for wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4 when a maid is hospitalized due to injury or illness, and how is the maximum reimbursement period determined?
How does the requirement of a successful claim under Section 2 impact the entitlement to wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4 for the loss of maid’s service?
In the event of a maid’s hospitalization, how is the pro-rata calculation of wages and government levy performed under Section 4, and what documentation might be required to substantiate the claim?
What is the maximum duration for which wages and levy reimbursement can be claimed under Section 4, and how does this period interact with the overall Period of Insurance?
How do the benefits under Section 3 and Section 4 interact when a claim involves both hospital and surgical expenses for the insured and hospitalization of the maid?
Are there any exclusions or conditions under which the waiver of the 25% co-payment in Section 3 would not apply even if the claim under Section 2 is successful?
Can the wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4 be claimed independently of other sections, or is it strictly conditional on a successful claim under Section 2?
How does the policy define the 'Period of Insurance' in relation to the maximum 30-day reimbursement period for maid’s wages and levy under Section 4?
What documentation or proof is required to demonstrate the maid’s hospitalization due to injury or illness to qualify for wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4?
How does the policy handle situations where the maid’s hospitalization extends beyond the 30-day maximum period for wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4?
In cases where the insured has multiple maids, how does the policy apply the wages and levy reimbursement benefit under Section 4, and are there any limits per maid or in aggregate?
How does the waiver of the 25% co-payment under Section 3 affect claims where the hospital and surgical expenses are partially covered by other insurance or third parties?

What are the implications for the insured if the claim under Section 2 is denied, in terms of eligibility for both the co-payment waiver under Section 3 and wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4?

How does the policy address the calculation of government levy on foreign domestic workers for the purpose of reimbursement under Section 4, especially if levy rates change during the Period of Insurance?
Are there any specific exclusions or general policy-wide exclusions that override the benefits described in Sections 3 and 4, such as pre-existing conditions or injuries due to excluded causes?
How does the policy ensure that the wages and levy reimbursement under Section 4 is only paid for the actual loss of service, and what measures prevent duplicate claims for the same period?
In the event of a claim involving both the insured’s hospital and surgical expenses and the maid’s hospitalization, how are the claims processed and coordinated under Sections 2, 3, and 4?

Does the policy provide any provisions for automatic extension or adjustment of the 30-day wages and levy reimbursement period under Section 4 in cases of delayed claim processing or ongoing hospitalization?
